intro: Pariti tricuspe, commonly known as the three-lobed pariti, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Pariti tricuspe thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
